subject: RE: [junit] Testing EJBs
msgSnippet: ... In EJB 2.0, CMPs are abstract classes implemented by the app server.  How would you test these in any meaningful way?  Even the SQL is generated in most
messageBody:
> Alexander Ananiev wrote:
>
> There is no reason why CMP entity beans can't run outside of the
> container.

In EJB 2.0, CMPs are abstract classes implemented by the app server. How would you test these in any meaningful way? Even the SQL is generated in most cases. Who uses CMP anyway? :-)

Scott Stirling
Workscape, Inc.
